results.title: Sauk-Ai
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones, Shelah Reljic, John Taylor and Tony Westman
results.brief_description: Based on a legend of the Tsimshian Indians of British Columbia, this film is about a spirit called Raven who takes the shape of a man. One day, as he is searching for food, he meets Salmon Woman who embodies the Spirit of the Salmon. Their life together unfolds in harmony until Raven forgets his happiness and turns on his wife in anger. Underlying this simple tale is the timeless reality of how fragile are the links between people and how easily they can be ruptured. This film is partly animated by Howard Pedlar and stars Frank Austin as “Raven” and Darlene Malczewska as “Salmon Woman”.

results.title: Saudi Arabia: the oil revolution
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Antony Thomas
results.brief_description: Probes the internal tension of Saudi Arabia, in transition since the oil boom of the mid 1960s and the reforms of King Faisal. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Satyajit Ray: creative artist of India
results.creator_credit: Contemporary Films, Indian Government Information Service and B.D. Garga
results.brief_description: A behind-the-camera portrait of one of the world’s greatest film makers. Ray himself provides the commentary, in which he talks of his development as a writer and director. In particular, he develops the theme that through the medium of film he has not only reached a greater understanding of his own country, but has also found a greater universal understanding. Illustrated by scenes from The Apu Trilogy.

results.title: Saturn's return
results.creator_credit: Helen Pankhurst, SBS Independent and Wenona Byrne
results.brief_description: Two men in love, Barney (Joel Edgerton) and Dimi (Damian Walshe-Howling) head up to Sydney from Melbourne on a road trip. Whilst on the way, the boys make a stop at Bonegilla, a migrant camp used in the 1950’s where Dimi’s parents had first met and lived. They continue onto Sydney, where Barney’s father, an aged-hippie struggles with the day-to-day practicalities of “living” with a terminal illness. As both Barney and Dimi’s love for each other intensifies, they revisit past memories as they address new experiences that test a maturing relationship. Issues of race, drugs, sexuality and family are brought to the surface with an affecting warmth that endears us to the characters. Story and screenplay written by Christos Tsiolkas.

results.title: Saturday school
results.creator_credit: Rick Cavaggion, Georgia Allan and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Ethnic language schools have been a part of Australia’s educational history since the 1850’s. However, until the advent of multiculturalism in the early 1970s, ethnic language schools were treated with disdain by the mainstream educational authorities who believed in assimilation programs for migrants rather than a continuing of cultural and linguistic ethnic traditions. In this video, the South Australian model for ethnic schools is investigated, including sources of financial assistance; the important work the schools do in maintaining respect for langauge and culture; and the role the schools now have in teaching new languages to children from English-speaking backgrounds.

results.title: Saturday parade
results.brief_description: A candid camera study with mood music of the Cape Town Parade on a typical Saturday. The second hand stalls and flower market; street sweepers; the carillon; street artists and photographers; children; the “table-cloth” coming down on Table Mountains; a hamburger stand and a horse cab a night.

results.title: Saturday night live
results.creator_credit: National Broadcasting Company, Michael Shoemaker, Marci Klein and Beth McCarthy
results.brief_description: Saturday night live debuted on October 11, 1975, introducing to American television an irreverent type of comedy that parodied sitcoms, chat shows, news, entertainment shows and American culture. “SNL” frequently used scatological and satirical humour that was frequently accused of being offensive to mainstream audiences. The show served to introduce a slew of comedians to the entertainment arena, many of whom went on to have stellar careers in film and television. This DVD is the 25th anniversary special that was aired in 1999 and featuring, among others, spots from Tom Hanks, Adam Sandler, Lily Tomlin, Alec Baldwin, Chevy Chase, Jon Lovitz, Martin Short, James Van Der Beek, Molly Shannon, Jerry Seinfeld, Drew Barrymore, Kevin Spacey, David Spade, Mike Myers, Steve Martin, Garth Brooks, Michael Douglas, Candice Bergen and Dan Ackroyd. Also contains archival footage of famous skits taken from the history of the show, including performances by Christopher Walken, Chris Farley, Eddie Murphy, Dana Carvey, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, John Belushi, Billy Crystal, Martin Short, Chris Rock, Al Franken, Madonna, Andy Kaufman and Bill Murray. The show featured many musical acts over the years and the highlights include: Elvis Costello, Sting, Steve Tyler, The Beastie Boys, Blondie, and David Bowie.

results.title: Saturday night fever
results.creator_credit: Robert Stigwood, Paramount Pictures and John Badham
results.brief_description: John Travolta and Karen Gorney star in the film that brought the “seventies generation” out of their homes and into the disco wearing gaberdine pants and platform shoes. After a week of work in a hardware store, Tony transforms himself into the local Disco King. His new dance partner Stephanie, and ex-priest brother, has Tony questioning the shallowness of his life. It is a fine piece of cinema, being not simply a disco dance, but a striking social commentary. The film is memorable for its great soundtrack; the original music being performed and written by the Bee Gees, for the excellence of the dancing and a fantastic performance from Travolta. A must for those who want to re-live a bygone era and connoisseurs of fashion.

results.title: Saturday night again
results.creator_credit: Richard Davis, Laughing Kookaburra Productions and Jan Sharp
results.brief_description: Looks at situations that could result in drink-driving, and also looks at the other options available through following the social life of a young Sydney group of friends made up of four males and one female in their late teens to early twenties. Covers willingness to intervene in a drink-driving situation; ability to say “no” to someone who wants to drive when he or she is unfit to do so; and alternative ways of spending an evening socialising without the risk of drink-driving. Features Gia Carrides. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
